sen.j: 陰摩羅鬼の名の由来は、仏教で悟りを妨げる魔物の摩羅（魔羅）に「陰」「鬼」の字をつけることで鬼・魔物の意味を強調したもの、もしくは障害を意味する「陰摩」と「羅刹天」の混合されたものとの説がある。
sen.e: The origin of the name of Onmoraki was adding words, 'in' (negative) and 'oni' (ogre) to the monster moro that prevented one's nirvana to stress on the definition of ogre and monster, and another theory stated that it was the mixture of 'Onmo' and 'Rasetsuten' (Rakshasa) having the definition of causing obstacles.

The name Onmoraki was reportedly created by adding words 'in' (negative) and 'oni' (ogre or ghost) to a monster 'mara' that hindered Buddhists from attaining enlightenment, to put stress on the meanings of ogre and monster, while another theory has it that it was a mixture of 'Onmo' meaning obstacles and 'Rasetsuten' (Rakshasa, an evil spirit).
